Package be.baur.sda

Class NodeSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractSet<E>
        • java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArraySet<Node>
          • be.baur.sda.NodeSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<Node>, java.util.Collection<Node>, java.util.Set<Node>
    public final class NodeSet
extends java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArraySet<Node>
    A NodeSet is an collection of Node objects. It extends a CopyOnWriteArraySet and defines several convenience methods to find or manipulate member nodes. Internally, a NodeSet is used to hold the child nodes of a parent node, in which case it is referred to as a "parent set". All supplied methods are "safe", e.g. parent-child integrity is maintained.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • add

        public boolean add​(Node node)
        Adds a node to this set. A null reference is silently ignored. If the set is a parent set, nodes that already have a parent will not be added.
        Specified by:

        true if the set was modified.

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll​(java.util.Collection<? extends Node> collection)
        Adds all nodes in the specified collection to this set if they are not already present. Will ignore a null argument. If the set is a parent set, nodes that already have a parent will not be added.
        Specified by:
        addAll in interface java.util.Collection<Node>
        Specified by:
        addAll in interface java.util.Set<Node>
        Overrides:
        addAll in class java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArraySet<Node>
        Returns:
        true if the set was modified.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all nodes from this set. If this is a parent set, removed nodes will be detached from their parent. The set will be empty after this call returns.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface java.util.Collection<Node>
        Specified by:
        clear in interface java.util.Set<Node>
        Overrides:
        clear in class java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArraySet<Node>

      • find

        public int find​(Node node)
        Returns the position of a node in the range [1 .. set.size()], or 0 if no such node exists in this set.

      • get

        public Node get​(int position)
        Returns the node at the specified position in the range [1 .. set.size()], or null if no such node exists in this set.

      • remove

        public boolean remove​(java.lang.Object object)
        Removes the specified object from this set if it is present. If this is a parent set and the object is a child node of that parent, this will detach the node from its parent. Will ignore a null argument.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

      • retainAll

        public boolean retainAll​(java.util.Collection<?> collection)
        Retains only the nodes in this set that are contained in the specified collection. In other words, removes from this set all nodes not contained in the specified collection. Will ignore a null argument.
        Specified by:
        retainAll in interface java.util.Collection<Node>
